Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TFileFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TFileFormatter
  • public class TFileFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
    TFileFormatter objects are responsible for serialize/de-serialize whole sets of series of cards (i.e. TSeriesList objects) in text based, both human and machine readable files. Several 'formats' are available to support both data exchange between modules of the tombolalib project itself, and to/from external tools, such databases, other applications, etc. Provided methods provide plenty of opportunities to write card files as you prefer. Available parameters (i.e. file format, support for jolly numbers, csv and strings delimiters, etc.) can be customized:
    • Simply using the default configurations already built in the tombolib library (configure by exception principle
    • Specifying preferred options using proper constructor when instantiating the TFileFormatter object
    • After object instantiation, using proper setter/getter methods
    • Overwriting the configuration settings at objects level directly when using the writeSeriesFile(...) or readSerieFile(...).
    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    TCardFormatter, TCardFormat

      TSeriesList readSeriesFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method reads a list of series of cards from a file previously created using writeSeriesFile(String, TSeriesList, TCardFormat, OpenOption) companion method on this class. It returns a TSeriesList object ready to be managed by all other TombolaLib classes and methods.  File format is automatically determined using tags on the file header lines.

      • writeSeriesFile

        public int writeSeriesFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                           TSeriesList cardSet)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method streams a set of series of cards to a file. It uses passed parameters to write a textual, both human and machine readable file containing tombola cards arranged as csv record lines, mixed with comment lines reporting useful, extra information: date/time of series generation, statistics about 'distance' between cards, random seed used, etc. Several formats are possible, see TCardFormat for some details.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name (or relative/absolute path) of the file you want to write.
        cardSet - the set of series you want write into the file
        Returns:
        the number of series written in the file, -1 in case of error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is there are issues during the spool on the text file
        See Also:
        TCardFormat, TCardFormatter

      • writeSeriesFile

        public int writeSeriesFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                           TSeriesList cardSet,
                           TCardFormat format,
                           java.nio.file.OpenOption options)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This is the most versatile method available in tombolalib to stream a set of series of cards to a file. It uses passed parameters to write a textual, both human and machine readable file containing tombola cards arranged as csv record lines, mixed with comment lines reporting useful, extra information: date/time of series generation, statistics about 'distance' between cards, random seed used, etc. Several formats are possible, see TCardFormat for some details.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name (or relative/absolute path) of the file you want to write.
        cardSet - the set of series you want write into the file
        format - the TCardFormat value you to use to serialize cards
        options - specify the behavior to have when writing the file: overwrite the file if already exists, go in append, raise an error. See StandardOpenOption.
        Returns:
        the number of series written in the file, -1 in case of error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is there are issues during the spool on the text file
        See Also:
        TCardFormat, TCardFormatter

      • readSeriesFile

        public TSeriesList readSeriesFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  TTombolaRuntimeException
        This method reads a list of series of cards from a file previously created using writeSeriesFile(String, TSeriesList, TCardFormat, OpenOption) companion method on this class. It returns a TSeriesList object ready to be managed by all other TombolaLib classes and methods.  File format is automatically determined using tags on the file header lines.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String containing the full or absolute path and file name to read
        Returns:
        a TSeriesSet object containing all read cards. Null if something goes wrong.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is issues raise when truing t read the specified text file
        TTombolaRuntimeException

      • readSeriesFile

        public TSeriesList readSeriesFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                                  TCardFormat format)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  TTombolaRuntimeException
        This method reads a list of series of cards from a file previously created using writeSeriesFile(String, TSeriesList, TCardFormat, OpenOption) companion method on this class.It returns a TSeriesList object ready to be managed by all other TombolaLib classes and methods.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String containing the full or absolute path and file name to read
        format - a TCardReader.TForma value identifying the TombolaLib specific file format used to save filename. Supported format are CSV, CSV_SPACED, TINY, TINY_SPACED and AUTO. If format is set to AUTO, readCardFile will try to figure out the real format checking tags in the first comment line of the file.
        Returns:
        a TSeriesSet object containing all read cards. Null if something goes wrong.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is issues raise when truing t read the specified text file
        TTombolaRuntimeException
